document_title: Atopic dermatitis: Causes, symptoms and prevention
subsection_content:
The most common first symptoms of atopic dermatitis are itching and red skin rashes. Next, the skin gradually shows symptoms such as roughness, peeling, inflammation and irritation, etc. These signs can flare up quickly or slowly in any area of ​​the body but are often concentrated in the skin. arm, elbow, back of the knee, cheek or scalp area. (3)
In addition, patients may also experience other symptoms including:
Appearance of dark or red/gray-brown patches of skin; Small blisters appear on the skin, oozing fluid when broken (this is a sign of infection in dermatitis); Patches of dry, scaly skin or blisters
Common symptoms of atopic dermatitis are itching and redness
In severe cases, severe dermatitis can cause reactions such as loss of appetite, fever, fatigue, etc.
